whatIs.title: What is ConvergENS?
whatIs.body:
ConvergENS is the collective that brings together the engaged associations and clubs of the École normale supérieure (ENS), in connection with student parties and unions.
It arose from a double frustration: on the one hand, often small association boards bending under the weight of volunteer work; on the other, new volunteers forced to choose between causes that speak to them just as much.
ConvergENS provides a shared space to follow each organization’s updates and keep the connection. From within the ENS, by coming together, we surface lines of convergence — and we also discuss the divides — across our struggles.

objectives.title: Our Objectives
objectives.intro:
Our main objective is to promote a horizontal education in citizenship—not only through the ballot box, but also through union, association, and party action.
To do this, we:

items.shareExperiences: organize experience-sharing sessions among volunteers to prevent activist burnout;
items.poolResources: pool our resources and carry shared advocacy (notably with the ENS leadership);
items.createSpaces: create inter-organization spaces for discussion and debate to share updates and coordinate.

howItWorks.title: How does ConvergENS work?
howItWorks.body:
ConvergENS is not an umbrella structure over its members, but a collective that brings them together. Associations and clubs are the decision-makers and vote in the General Assembly on everything concerning the collective (upcoming events, welcoming new members, etc.). Parties and unions are invited members: they contribute in particular to Agora (ConvergENS’ journal) and to its launch conferences.
To join ConvergENS, simply get involved in a member (or invited) organization and become its representative within the collective.

row1.title: Bringing associations together
row1.body: Convergence des Luttes connects clubs, unions and collectives at the ENS so they can discover each other, collaborate, and share resources in one place.

row2.title: Publish and share easily
row2.body: Each collective has a secure space where they can keep their profile up to date and publish articles or news, without any particular technical skills.

row3.title: Simple, accessible and non‑profit
row3.body: The project is carried out on a voluntary basis: a lightweight platform with low cost, respectful of accessibility standards and open to all goodwill.
